last_nameGroup.notes: Father of Ceferino Salgado Castañeda

Ricardo de Jesús Santiago is a botanist who was working first in the Laboratorio de Plantas Vasculares, Facultad de Ciencias, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, in the team of Nelly Diego. He then started, around 2011, a doctorate with Gerardo Salazar in the Instituto de Biología. He has helped collect in the Balsas Valley, the Pacific Coast (Yoloxóchitl) and the Sierra Nororiental de Puebla (mpio. Cuetzalan)
Native speaker consultant on ethnobiological research.

Daniel Tejero is an expert on ferns who has worked with Amith on an inventory of ferns in the municipality of Cuetzalan and has identified all specimens collected there.
Nacido en Caltepec, estado de Puebla
last_nameGroup.type: Field botanist, worked for one field trip, July 2014

last_nameGroup.notes: Alin Torres was an assistant and student of Daniel Tejero. She collected ferns in the field in Cuetzalan several times and later began a degree program at the Instituto de Biología, UNAM.
Over 70 years old in 2017.
last_nameGroup.type: Totonac consultant for botanical collections, medicinal plant specialist.
